description: The root cause of the installation failure associated with the KB5034441 security update is related to inadequate partition size created during the installation of a brand new Windows 10 operating system from the latest ISOs. Specifically, the installation process generates a recovery partition that is only 522MB, which is insufficient to accommodate the update's requirements. This lack of proper partition management leads to the update failing and displaying a 0x80070643 error. Additionally, the problem is exacerbated by the fact that this update is primarily pushed to unmanaged environments, which include businesses utilizing Windows Update for Business and Intune, as well as consumers without TPM chips. The situation highlights deficiencies in communication regarding system requirements prior to rollout, impacting user trust in Microsoft’s patch management practices.
